runs.comm: back of a length outside off, a bit of angle in, left alone

dropped! Soumya Sarkar dives forward from second slip after Chandimal plays with an open face, looking to steer to third man, off a shortish ball from Taskin outside off. Doesn't middle it, and it was catchable, but it hits the heels of Sarkar's hands and pops out
beauty. Straightens in the corridor and there's some extra bounce as well, to square up Chandimal and beat him as he defends. No footwork at all to the back-of-a-length ball
a bit fuller and wider, not quite a half-volley, and Chandimal swishes and misses, going for the flat-bat cover drive
back of a length, comes in just a touch from outside off. Chandimal defends into the covers

back of a length outside off, dabbed away to the left of third man, gets it far enough wide of the fielder to pick up four. He was trying a similar shot off the ball that he was dropped off, but that one bounced a bit more and did not offer him this little bit of extra width
back of a length, angling in from outside off. Dilshan looks to whip it into the leg side but it comes on a touch too quickly for that, he ends up playing it back to the bowler

shortish outside off, the inward angle cramps Dilshan slightly as he looks to flay this away through the covers, hits it straighter than he would like and without as much power, towards the left of mid-off
length ball jagging in slightly from outside off. Gets forward and works it away to the right of midwicket
length ball slightly wide of off, Chandimal presses forward and steers to third man
shortish outside off, pulled straight to square leg

another drop! This is contagious. Mahmudullah this time, diving to his right from wide slip. It's a length ball outside off, and Dilshan plays away from his body at it, looking to force it away through the covers. It straightens, takes his edge, and Mahmudullah gets his hand to it but can't hold on
length ball outside off, plenty of swinging room for Dilshan. He clears his front leg and simply swats it away wide of mid-on
back of a length, slants in sharply to deny Dilshan room as he goes on the back foot, and he stabs it away into the cover point region
back of a length, angling into off stump, pushed gently to the right of short cover and he immediately sets off for the single
slower ball wide of off stump, that's too much width. Plants his front foot forward and slaps it away to the right of point
back of a length on off stump, and again they take a single with a gentle push to the right of short cover
back of a length outside off, chopped to backward point

down the track, Dilshan gets nowhere near the pitch of this one, tossed up just that bit slower. Goes through with the big shot, doesn't time it at all, and it goes high in the air behind the bowler, and Sarkar makes up for that drop with a stunning grab, charging diagonally towards the boundary from mid-off, catching the ball with both hands as it comes down from over his shoulder, and completing the catch with a slide on his elbows
short of a length near off stump, dabbed late with the turn towards short third man
tossed up outside off, turning into the left-hander, defended into the off side
down the track second ball and he finds the gap, Shakib flighted this and gave him a bit of width outside off, and he drove with a full follow-through to drill it wide of extra cover

lovely flight, and Jayasuriya doesn't get fully forward to drive this. It dips, turns into him, and causes his bat to turn in his hand and the ball to pop up towards midwicket, but it falls just short of the diving Mushfiqur
tossed up on the stumps, driven to long-on
back of a length on middle and leg, no room for Jayasuriya, whose back foot stays stuck on leg stump, a la Shikhar Dhawan, and he defends softly into the off side
now he makes himself room by stepping down the track and away from leg stump, and gets under this length ball on the stumps to lift it high over mid-off
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and dabs to backward point
fuller now, on middle and off, and he eases it down the ground, to the left of mid-off, forces Mashrafe into a good diving stop
shortish outside off, and Bangladesh do not have anyone in the slips. Chandimal lets it come on and dabs it late, just wide of the keeper, uses the pace well on this occasion
length ball angling into off stump. Chandimal aims a drive through extra cover, and the angle forces him to push down to mid-on instead
length ball on middle stump, looked like the slower one. Lets it come on and defends into the on side

very full, slanting away from off stump, and Chandimal gets forward to stab it away to the left of third man. Hit the outside half of his bat and went very quickly, difficult for Al-Amin to stop that on the bounce

did that carry? Nurul says no. Back of a length, slanting across Chandimal. That was the slower one, and he's opened up by it as he looks to play with an open face again. Gets a thin edge on it, and it drops short of the keeper falling forward
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the point region
another slower ball, fuller and wider this time. Chandimal slogs at it, looking to hit over mid-off, and can't make any contact
bouncer, Chandimal ducks under it, and that one definitely rose well over head height. Nurul had to jump in the air to take that above his head
good short ball, rising steeply and angling across the batsman's body. Jumps in the air, tries to fend it away into the on side, and gets a leading edge that drops down to the right of wide slip
short, wide, that sits up at a nice height for Chandimal to slash away, with no intention of keeping the ball down, over the backward point fielder
short again, closer to off stump this time, pulled away to deep backward square leg
length ball on middle stump, stays next to the line, lets it come on, and steers to third man
back of a length close to off stump, dabbed gently to third man

slower ball on leg stump, clipped to midwicket. Didn't realise he hit it almost straight to the fielder, Shakib, and took off for the single, but turned around quickly enough to make it back without too much bother
length ball on middle and off, lets it come on and pushes with an open face into the point region
shortish on middle stump, they seem to have done their homework on Jayasuriya, bowling straight lines at him and giving him no width. Lets it come on and dabs to third man
back of a length outside off, and now it's Chandimal's turn to dab down to third man
length ball on middle and leg, Jayasuriya remains stuck on the crease and opens up, plays with an open face once again to squeeze it down to third man
short, a bit of width, cut away fiercely but straight to backward point
back of a length outside off, dabbed to third man
shortish on leg stump, and again Jayasuriya doesn't get behind the line. Jumps and looks to dab it behind point again, can only play it down into the pitch, off the inside half of his bat
a bit of extra bounce, Chandimal makes room to cut, ends up falling away and losing balance, his edge is beaten
makes room again, this one isn't as short, forces it away towards sweeper cover
shortish on off stump, makes room and chops it away to the left of sweeper cover
tossed up much slower, drops a touch shorter than Jayasuriya expects as he aims a big drive through the covers, slices it away, in the air, through point
back of a length, turning in towards middle stump, makes room and chops down into the covers
goes for the big reverse-swat, and he seemed to make his move too early. The bowler spotted it, bowled it a bit slower and straighter, and it turned past his shot to hit him on the thigh
length ball turning in towards off stump, swept away to long leg

down the track, and once again a Sri Lankan batsman doesn't get to the pitch of a tossed-up Shakib delivery. Looks to hit over the top, down the ground, and it dips, turns away, and slices away towards deep backward point
too full to sweep, ends up dragging it down through baxkward square leg off the inside edge

now Jayasuriya steps down premeditately, slogs wildly across the line as Shakib shortens his length outside off. Thick inside edge runs away to short fine leg, they chance the quick single, and Chandimal just about makes it to beat the throw to the keeper's end
down the track and this time Shakib bowls it quicker and flatter on off stump. Chandimal can't get to the pitch, and blocks it out into the covers
this time it's too short to sweep. Shakib changes his pace again, slows it down on an off-stump line, and the top-edge loops over the keeper and drops softly into the unmanned area behind him
length ball targeting leg stump, swept to long leg
tossed up a little wide of off, and Jayasuriya jumps out at it, makes a bit of room for himself and lifts it on the up, over extra cover

has he overbalanced there? Looked to make room for the late dab, there wasn't much turn on it, and he fell away from his shot after the ball beat his outside edge. Nurul has the bails off in a flash but Jayasuriya kept his back foot firmly grounded behind the crease
once again, no room to dab, and he jams his bat down to squeeze it into the on side
and again, Chandimal premeditates the reverse-sweep. Mahmudullah bowls it slower and shorter, and he gloves it away over the keeper, into the short fine leg region
again Mahmudullah bowls it shorter as he sees Chandimal shaping to reverse-sweep. Goes through with the shot, doesn't really get hold of it, and scoops a simple catch to the man at deep point
length ball outside off, stops on the batsman, poked down to long-on
tossed up wide of off, jumps out and drives it firmly, but short cover dives to his right to stop it

this time he leaves his crease too early, and Shakib bowls it shorter and wide of off stump. Jayasuriya reaches out frantically, can't make contact, and the keeper does the rest. The spinners are making critical strikes for Bangladesh
length ball outside off, blocked into the covers
back of a length, turning down leg, tucked away through backward square leg
flighted and full on off stump, Mathews drives down the ground, and hits the stumps at the other end
flatter now, angling into middle stump with no turn, punches off the back foot towards long-on but midwicket quickly moves to his left to intercept
length ball outside off and Perera pushes hard at it in front of his body, doesn't move his feet into that drive, and pops it up in the air, but it doesn't carry to Sarkar at mid-off
length ball, a touch wider, can't quite find the gap with the flat-batted drive, short extra cover dives left and stops it
back of a length on middle stump, straightens a touch, tucked defensively to midwicket
back of a length down the leg side, Mathews misses the flick off the hip
back of a length close to off stump, goes on the back foot and pushes towards mid-off
back of a length on middle and leg, Mathews shuffles across and nudges it into the square leg region

length ball on off stump, looks to slog it away over the leg side and checks his shot as he sees a little more bounce, and he ends up skewing it high in the air over short fine leg. Taskin runs back towards the rope, to his left, dives to his left and gets his hands to it, but can't hold on. Difficult chance, but it probably counts as a drop.

back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and pushes to the left of short cover, takes off for the quick single .Shakib moves quickly towards the ball, turns and throws to the bowler's end. Misses the stumps, and Mathews would have just made it even if he had hit

super change of length, slips in the full ball angled into the stumps. Perera falls over, plays around his front pad while trying to flick, and misses the ball. Hits low on the front pad, and that looked as plumb as plumb can be, on first glance. Pitched on off, struck in front of middle, hitting leg stump, is what ball tracking stays.
nice and full on off stump, stays inside the line and opens his bat face to play that to sweeper cover
fullish on the pads, whipped away to the left of long leg
wide yorker, Mathews reaches out and jams it in the ground, and the keeper times his jump well to catch that as it bounced up off the turf
back of a length angling across Mathews, and he's opened up by the angle. No footwork as he defends, and it slips past his outside edge

length ball angling away from off stump. Siriwardana looks for the drive over the covers, gets a thick edge that bounces down towards third man. Went to the right of the fielder, they could have taken two, but Siriwardana didn't take the first one quickly enough
length ball on off stump, dabbed gently towards point

slower short ball on off stump, keeps a bit low. Siriwardana adjusts well and plays a checked pull towards deep square leg. Mathews jogs the first, Siriwardana sprints it and wants the second, he's sent back
slower length ball outside off, Mathews clears his front leg, slogs across the line, misses
back of a length on off stump, looks like another slower ball. Stops on Mathews and he pokes it away into the covers for another single
slower ball on off stump, and Siriwardana holes out! Picks the change of pace, clears his front leg, sets himself up nicely on a wide base, slogs it away, and picks out the fielder at deep midwicket
back of a length, slanting in towards off stump, punched away into the covers
shortish outside off, stops on the batsman, no pace to hit square of the wicket, has to flat-bat down the ground to long-off
back of a length, sliding in with the angle into off and middle. Steps across and works through midwicket
length ball close to off stump, squeezed away to sweeper cover
back of a length outside off, flat-batted to the left of extra cover
tossed up slow, on a good length just outside off, makes a bit of room and squeezes it to the left of point
shortish on off stump, clears his front leg and swats it away to deep midwicket, who's stationed alnost at wide long-on
length ball outside off, Mathews whips with a lot of bottom hand to mid-on. Takes a hurried single, and a direct hit would have had him out by a few centimetres
slower length ball, angles across the right-hander and nips away from the stumps. Slogs across it, misses it, and the ball doesn't miss off stump by much
full outside off, stabbed to sweeper cover
this one's full and quick, angling away wide of off stump. Saw Mathews step down the pitch and fires it wide of him. Reaches out to it, can't make contact
makes a bit of room to a full ball on off stump, jabs it down to long-off

length ball wide of off, it leaves the batsman a touch off the pitch. Mathews goes for the big hit over the covers, ends up slicing it high over point. Shakib moves towards the boundary, with the ball dropping down from behind him. Juggles it once, but catches it on the second attempt

back of a length outside off, not short enough to pull. Misses it, and the keeper goes up for a caught behind appeal. No bat on that at all, and they missed an opportunity to sneak a bye, because Nurul threw that ball high in the air
shot, Shanaka! Another shortish ball, this one just sat up, and he pulled it off the front foot, high over the wide long-on boundary
this one skids through a bit quicker, and he pulls it along the ground, towards long-on
length ball outside off. Kapugedera plants his front leg across and swats it away through square leg
yorker on middle stump, hits the bottom of the bat on the full as Kapugedera jams down to dig it out, back towards the bowler
oh, Mustafiz, superb. Fired full outside off, and Shanaka, looking to make himself room, falls over as he tries to jam his bat down on it. It's past him too quickly
low full-toss on off stump, swiped to long-on
fullish outside off, and he brings his bottom hand into play to whip that to the right of deep midwicket
wide yorker. Looks to squeeze it through the covers, ends up jabbing it back to the bowler off the bottom of the bat
ha. Shanaka steps across his stumps this time, shaping for the scoop over short fine leg. Mustafizur sees it, follows him with the yorker, and slides it between his legs
full-toss on middle stump, at thigh height. Slogs across the line, misses, and it hits his thigh pad and rolls into the covers
low full-toss close to off stump, Shanaka slogs, and the ball hits high on the outside half of the bat, loops up in the air, and straight into short cover's hands
yorker on off stump, squeezed back past the bowler, down to long-on
full on off stump. Kulasekara plays a whippy lofted hit down the ground, picks out long-on
dug in short outside off, pulled to deep midwicket

full on off stump, and that's a clean strike from Kapugedera. All too late, but a good shot nonetheless, clears his front leg and swings through the line to hit straight back over the bowler, to the right of long-off
slower bouncer outside off, Kapugedera misses the pull, and all of Bangladesh celebrates
